Articles.Content:
Through a process that I call, “being bored and destroying ships through bdarmoury” (or “BBADSTBDA”) I discovered that lasers would be the perfect tool for a space battle in KSP. So thus, I announce the Star Navy Battles for v.1.7.3! It is simple, competitors build a Starship equipped with lasers from bdarmory using the AI flight computer.They will battle over Kerbin, with the use of no mods except bdarmory. In addition you may not use more than one layer of armor or use invisible armor from DCK. To complete, you must submit a link to your craft on KerbalX. 
Design rules:

1. No more than 10 laser cannons.

2. Only stock parts with exception of bdarmory lasers.

3. Fighters are allowed, but you cannot have more than 5.

4. Engines on starships are allowed, but not recommended since ships might no move much. Fighters can also have engines (you probably want them to).

5. Must carry at least 3 Kerbals.

6. Nothing else go stupid, go crazy, go strategic, whatever!

Okay I'm really confused how the battles are gonna work. So we have have Airborne Laser turret. Will this be in LKO, Kerbin's surface? Will there be air? Will Gravity be hacked?

BDA AI pilot doesn't much like working in vacuum in my experience. It yaws all over the place and spins out like a maniac trying to correct its own mistakes.

Do fighters need laser cannons or can they have something else like missiles or guns?

Can fighters use missile guidance AI to kamikaze themselves into the enemy ship?

Oh, if my starship has an engine, it's gonna move. Don't worry about that.

Is intentional starship ramming allowed?
